docs.snippet: THESE are balmy days on the American left -- genuine, uncharacteristic sunniness unpolluted by some fluky political climate change. There is even talk of a -- stutter, clear-throat, perish-thought -- liberal resurgence.      Or, treading gingerly,...
docs.lead_paragraph: THESE are balmy days on the American left -- genuine, uncharacteristic sunniness unpolluted by some fluky political climate change. There is even talk of a -- stutter, clear-throat, perish-thought -- liberal resurgence. Or, treading gingerly, a ''liberal moment.''
docs.abstract: Liberals are feeling optimistic about Democratic Party but it is unclear how much 'liberal moment' is due to genuine momentum or anti-Bush administration, anti-Republican fervor; it is clear that issues once largely consigned to liberalism have suddenly gained mainstream acceptance and urgency; drawing; photos (M)

docs.snippet: STONE--Oscar Jay, passed away peacefully after a long illness on February 15th. Loving husband of the late Pearl. Beloved father of Elliot and cherished uncle of Wendy Sue (Asher) Fogel. Adored brother of Helen Stein and the late Elaine and Arnold...
docs.lead_paragraph: STONE--Oscar Jay, passed away peacefully after a long illness on February 15th. Loving husband of the late Pearl. Beloved father of Elliot and cherished uncle of Wendy Sue (Asher) Fogel. Adored brother of Helen Stein and the late Elaine and Arnold Tanzer, Selma D. Marquis, and Bea and Moe Oberhand. Also a dear uncle to Robert and Eric Oberhand. A long time resident of Manhattan, formerly of Rockville Centre, NY, this handsome, elegant and charming young man enlisted in the US Navy in WWII and flew hundreds of missions in the Pacific Theater, becoming one of the Navys most highly decorated pilots. Although he continued to fly throughout his life, after the War he turned his attention to the world of fashion, and became President of one of the country's largest privately owned women's coat companies, Naman Rainwear. Jay loved his life, his family, his golden retrievers and all things of beauty. He was forever young, and shall be forever in our hearts. Services Sunday 9AM at the Riverside, 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths   STONE, OSCAR JAY

docs.snippet: There's big money in show business. Who knew?...
docs.lead_paragraph: The mystery that is hanging over this year's Oscars has apparently been good for business. Stuart Elliot writes in today's New York Times that this year's Academy Awards show is sold to the rafters:
docs.abstract: There's big money in show business. Who knew?

docs.snippet: A director so good he makes even journalists watchable....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger is a bit of a fanboy when it comes to Billy Ray and is fired up to see "Breach," his take on FBI agent's Robert Hanssen's freaky trip to the other side of the fence. Mr. Ray showed directness and muscle in "Shattered Glass," one of the few movies about journalism that is actually interesting to watch. The Bagger interviewed him a while back, but he didn't get him talking about his Oscar lust, something Chris Hewitt at the Pioneer Press managed to do.
docs.abstract: A director so good he makes even journalists watchable.
